alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 10:14AM EST until January 08 at 2:24AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Lexington, Richland and Calhoun Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Saluda and Greenwood Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River At Chappells. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. At 18.0 feet, The Saluda River Campground including the Campground Store downstream from Chappells becomes flooded. Campers should move to higher ground. At 21.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs. Farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Much of the Saluda River Campground downstream from Chappells become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EST Friday was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.7 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 11 PM EST.
